content:
Mettler-Toledo (MTD) noted its Board of Directors authorized an additional $2.75 billion to be added to the share repurchase program, which had $1.1 billion remaining as of September 30, 2025. The Company expects the additional authorization will be utilized over the next few years, and that the repurchases will be made through open-market transactions, and the amount and timing will depend on business and market conditions, stock price, trading restrictions, the level of acquisition activity, and other factors.

key_facts: Mettler-Toledo's Board of Directors authorized an additional $2.75 billion for its share repurchase program.
As of September 30, 2025, $1.1 billion remained in the existing share repurchase program.
The additional $2.75 billion authorization is expected to be utilized over the next few years.
Share repurchases will be conducted through open-market transactions.
The timing and amount of repurchases depend on business and market conditions.
Stock price is a factor influencing the timing and volume of repurchases.
Trading restrictions may affect the execution of share repurchases.
The level of acquisition activity could impact repurchase decisions.
Other unspecified factors will influence repurchase strategy.
Mettler-Toledo is a publicly traded company listed on major financial exchanges.
The company operates in the industrial and measurement technology sector.
The share repurchase program is part of MTD’s capital allocation strategy.
Board approval was required for the expansion of the repurchase program.
The repurchase program does not have a fixed timeline or specific quarterly targets.
Repurchases are subject to regulatory and compliance requirements.
MTD has previously announced amendments to executive employment agreements.
JPMorgan raised Mettler-Toledo’s price target from $1,200 to $1,285.
Barclays increased Mettler-Toledo’s price target from $1,325 to $1,350.
Evercore upgraded Mettler-Toledo’s rating to ‘Tactical Underperform’.
